chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Davies was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Give DNA sample.
Register as a sex offender.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18, without prior agent approval.
Sex offender treatment and aftercare.
Defendant not to use Internet or possession of any hardware, software or electronic devices capable of downloading software.
No email address/no passwords.  Agent may okay computer rules needed for employment purposes.
Absolute sobriety.
Obtain or maintain full-time employment.
Comply with child support orders including job searches if ordered.
Enter into, participate in & successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or reatment programs as directed by the agent.
AODA treatment and aftercare.
Agent to review residency so not within 1000 ft of where children would normally congregate unless agent approved.
No class B establishents without agent approval.

timeConds.notes: w/work release; credit for time served since 10/11/2014

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy J Davies in court with attorney Ronald D. Haacke.  Defendant Jeremy J Davies in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Bond continues with all conditions.

Defendant Jeremy J Davies in court with attorney Ronald D. Haacke.  Defendant Jeremy J Davies in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Haacke moves to have witnesses sequestered.  Court so orders.  DA Parker calls Dep. ED by phone.  Court swears in Dep. ED.  Objection-foundation-sustained.  Dep JS sworn & testifies. Cross-exam.  Det. TU sworn & testifies. Witness id's DE.  Cross-exam.  Re-direct.  Closing statements.  Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
